directions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, eggs, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook the other side until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes more.
Serve with syrup, butter, or your favorite toppings.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk mashed bananas, buttermilk, eggs, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook the other side until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes more.
Serve warm with butter and maple syrup.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, eggs, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in the chocolate chips.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook the other side until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes more.
Serve warm with syrup.
Whisk eggs in a bowl with salt and pepper.
Melt butter in a pan over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook until edges set.
Sprinkle cheese on top and fold the omelet in half.
Cook for an additional minute until cheese melts.
Serve hot.
Heat olive oil in a pan and saut√© mushrooms until soft.
Whisk eggs with salt and pepper.
Pour eggs over mushrooms and cook until edges set.
Sprinkle cheese on top and fold the omelet.
Serve hot.
Whisk eggs in a bowl with salt and pepper.
Melt butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook until edges set.
Sprinkle cheese on top and fold the omelet in half.
Cook for an additional minute until cheese melts.
Serve hot.
In a bowl, combine dry ingredients.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Serve with syrup or toppings of your choice.
In a bowl, combine dry ingredients.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Serve with whipped cream or chocolate syrup.
In a bowl, combine dry ingredients.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, milk, melted butter.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Fold in fresh fruit.
Heat waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Serve warm with syrup or extra fruit.
Blend all ingredients until smooth.
Serve immediately.
Blend all ingredients until smooth.
Serve immediately.
Blend all ingredients until smooth.
Serve immediately.
Combine greens, cucumber, tomato, and red onion in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper and toss well.
Serve immediately.
Place romaine lettuce in a bowl.
Add Caesar dressing and toss to coat evenly.
Top with croutons and Parmesan cheese.
Serve immediately.
Mix cooked pasta, tuna, and peas in a bowl.
Add mayonnaise and lemon juice, and mix well.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled.
Combine cooked pasta, tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar.
Sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper, and toss well.
Serve chilled.
Mix boiled potatoes, mayonnaise, mustard, celery, and onion in a bowl.
Season with salt and pepper and stir well.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Cook bacon in a skillet until crispy, then remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, saut√© onion.
Add vinegar, sugar, and mustard, and stir to combine.
Mix in boiled potatoes and cooked bacon, and toss well.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve warm.
Combine pineapple, mango, kiwi, and strawberries in a bowl.
Drizzle with honey and lime juice.
Gently toss to coat.
Serve chilled.
Mix blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries in a bowl.
Drizzle with orange juice and honey.
Toss gently and serve immediately.
Toast the bread slices until golden brown.
Cook the bacon in a pan until crispy.
Spread mayonnaise on one slice of bread.
Layer the bacon, lettuce, and tomato on the bread.
Top with the second slice of bread.
Cut in half and serve.
Heat olive oil in a pot and saut√© onion and garlic until soft.
Add tomatoes and vegetable broth. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Blend the soup until smooth and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot.
Toss the lettuce with Caesar dressing and sliced chicken.
Place the mixture in the center of the tortilla.
Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and roll up the tortilla.
Serve immediately.
Grill the beef patty until cooked to your liking.
Place a slice of cheese on top of the patty and melt.
Toast the hamburger bun.
Assemble the burger with lettuce, tomato, pickles, and condiments.
Serve immediately.
Preheat the oven to 475¬∞F (245¬∞C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread tomato sauce over the dough.
Top with mozzarella cheese and basil leaves.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
Drizzle with olive oil before serving.
Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Rub the chicken with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, paprika, and rosemary.
Stuff the cavity with lemon halves and garlic.
Place chicken in a roasting pan and roast for 1.5 hours, basting occasionally.
Let rest for 10 minutes before carving.
Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Mix butter with parsley, thyme, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Gently loosen the chicken skin and spread the herb butter underneath.
Roast the chicken for 1 hour 40 minutes, basting with pan drippings.
Let rest before serving.
Marinate chicken in buttermilk for 4 hours or overnight.
Mix flour with paprika, garlic powder, cayenne, salt, and pepper.
Dredge the chicken in the flour mixture and shake off excess.
Heat oil in a skillet and fry chicken until golden brown and cooked through.
Drain on paper towels and serve.
Combine buttermilk and hot sauce and marinate chicken for 4 hours.
Mix flour with chili powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Dredge chicken in flour mixture and fry in hot oil until crispy and cooked through.
Serve hot with dipping sauce.
Fry chicken wings in hot oil until crispy and golden.
Mix hot sauce, melted butter, and vinegar in a bowl.
Toss fried wings in the sauce mixture until evenly coated.
Serve with celery sticks and ranch dressing.
Fry chicken wings in hot oil until crispy.
Mix barbecue sauce, honey, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Toss fried wings in the honey BBQ sauce.
Serve warm.
Marinate chicken tenders in buttermilk for 30 minutes.
Dredge tenders in flour, then coat in panko mixed with paprika, salt, and pepper.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
Mix Parmesan, panko, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder.
Dip chicken tenders in beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumb mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, turning halfway.
Serve with marinara sauce.
